SENT.plain: Klippel-Trenaunay syndrome (KTS) is characterized by port-wine hemangiomas, deep venous system abnormalities, superficial varicosities, and bony and soft-tissue hypertrophy
When associated with an arteriovenous fistula, it has been termed Klippel-Trenaunay-Parkes-Weber syndrome
It is imperative that both the radiologist and surgeon be aware of this entity, as incomplete evaluation and inappropriate surgery may be devastating
Radiological workup includes phlebography, angiography, and conventional radiography of the involved extremities
Surgery should be performed only to relieve deep venous obstruction (if present) or to correct inequality in the lengths of legs
Removal of superficial varicosities is contraindicated because it will worsen existing symptoms
Five cases of KTS are presented and the literature reviewed
